resources.string: Welcome to the <IslandName> Bank.
Hmph. What do you need?
Show me my account.
Let's chat.
Nevermind.
Ok. Lets take a look...
Have a great day.
<proud>Hmph.
I usually buy my own <birthday> gifts.
Thank you, <PlayerName>.
<proud>Hmph.
Very good.
I suppose you would like a reward now?
<PlayerName> I assume?
<proud>My name is <myName>.
<yes>I am the new banker here on <IslandName>.
Am I to understand that you were instrumental in getting my magnificent bank built?
<proud>Well, trust me, the honour is all yours for having <myName> here on your tiny little island.
Hmph. Using my bank will be free, of course.
Would you like me to explain how the bank works?
Yes please.
I get it.
Well it’s very simple.
Any <Dinks> you deposit in the bank will slowly accrue interest.
<no>Hmph. You'll be bleeding me dry, I tell you!
Additionally, any <Dinks> you place into your account can be extracted from any other bank you visit.
That means if you visit somewhere and they have a bank, you can withdraw what few precious little <Dinks> you have deposited.
<yes>Finally, I offer a little exchange scheme.
You see, I happen to have to many <PermitPoints>.
<no>And you can never have have too many <Dinks>.
So come and speak to me during my operating hours to exhange <Dinks> for <PermitPoints>
<thinking>Ah, I see, someone on this island who knows the ins and outs of finance.
<yes>Looking forward to seeing your <Dinks>, <PlayerName>.
Hmph.
Today has been satisfactory so far.
However, I do doubt that the “surprise” <NPCName> has in store for us tonight will impress me.
<no>Hmph.
What even is a <SnagSizzle>?
What’s so good about <Snags> anyway?
Hmph.
I don’t know what to say.
I’ve never seen anything like this before...
Hmph.
I hate to admit it.
<no>But these “<Snags>” are actually very nice.
<yes>I will have to invest in some more of these.
You know what I always say, <PlayerName>?
<yes>You’ve got to speculate to accumulate.
Remember that!
You know what I always say, <PlayerName>?
<yes>Diversify! Diversify! Diversify!
Remember that!
It’s important to shares, <PlayerName>
<haha>I should know. I own them all!
You know what I always say, <PlayerName>?
<yes>There’s the one percent, and the won percent!
<proud>Let me tell you, <PlayerName>, I always win.
<thinking>If I had all the gold in the world, I would buy more gold with it, and then sell that gold for fat stacks of gold.
<thinking>Hmph...
<haha>I’d be a bullionaire!
Counting money can be exhausting. <sigh>
What?
<no>There's no way I would pay someone to do that!
<pumped>I've got to hold on to every single Dink I can.
<thinking>I was visited in my sleep by three ghosts once.
<shocked>They said they wanted to take me on a life changing journey!
<no>Too bad for them that they couldn't afford my hourly rate, so I just went back to sleep.
<yes>Hmph, things ran better back in <SouthCity>.
People had more trust in banks back there.
People just did what they were told!
I’ll tell you what, back in <SouthCity> everyone knew who I was.
<proud>I was constantly getting recognised.
<no>Why, I could hardly walk down the street without being booed.
<thinking>They say <Dinks> make the world go around...
But go around where?
How many?
<angry>And, more importantly, what’s the world doing going around with my <Dinks>?
<no>I don’t really have time to talk right now.
<yes>Time is <Dinks> and my time is worth more <Dinks> than yours, <PlayerName>.
<yes>Give a man a <Dink> and he’ll eat for a day.
<proud>Give a man a million <Dinks> and that man will never work again!
<yes>A very wise and true proverb that I live my life by, <PlayerName>.
<yes>Although I do miss <SouthCity>, I think there's some incredible opportunities here on <IslandName>.
<glee>A brand new market ripe for exploitation.
<shy>Exploration, I mean exploration, of course.
<thinking>Hmph, I'd love to cut costs at the bank...
<no>But, I simply can't afford to lower my salary.
<proud>Don't worry, your <Dinks> are safe with me!
<glee>Plus, they have a boatload of other <Dinks> to play with.
I started out with a small loan of 1,000,000 <Dinks> from my father.
<haha>Hmph, and now, I run my own bank!
<shy>I know, I know, I’m very humble.
<glee>I love the rain.
<yes>It's nature's way of giving my building a free wash.
<haha>You just can't beat free!
<worried>Try not to take out too many <Dinks> at once, it makes me sweat like crazy.
<shy>Withdrawal symptoms are no joke.
<no>I didn’t really need <PermitPoints> back in <SouthCity>.
<yes>You don’t need a <Licence> to do anything if you just pay someone with a <Licence> to do it for you!
<no>I never did eat <BlobFish>.
<shocked>Why would I ever sully my taste buds on something that looks so ghastly!
<proud>I would always import fine foods from other places!
<thinking>I’ve seen you out there breaking rocks and chopping trees.
Have you ever though of maybe paying someone else to do all that hard work for you?
Hmph. I guess you can't afford that?
<thinking>You know, <PlayerName>...
<thinking>I never realised how much money you inject into the economy here on <IslandName>.
<shy>Maybe you aren’t so bad after all?
You know that famous saying, “A <Dink> in the bank is better than a <Dink> in the hand”?
I know it
That's not a saying.
<proud>I’m the one that came up with that saying.
<angry>And don't listen to anyone else who says they did!
<angry>How dare you!
<proud>I’m the one that came up with that saying.
<angry>I’ve been trying to settle a legal battle for years in regards to that!
You know what I like about you, <PlayerName>?
<no>You’re not great at anything. Not good, even.
But you’re still out there, day after day.
<yes>Just having a go. Giving it a shot.
<yes>Marvellous.
<thinking>Whenever I’m feeling down, I find it helps to imagine that somewhere out there, a lot of people are feeling a whole lot worse.
<proud>With not nearly as many <Dinks>!
<haha>It never fails to brighten my day.
<sigh>Childhood was a difficult time for me.
So much to learn, you see. \nWhich bell to ring for afternoon tea?
Which spoon to use for what?
<yes>Oh, the servants tried their best, of course.
<no>It was impossible to find good help.
<yes>People in charge should stay in charge.
<thinking>It’s so obvious, really.
Experience, see.
<no>Can’t beat it.
<no>I feel like there are FAR too many resources here on <IslandName>!
If everybody has everything they need, what’s the point of being rich?
<proud>Hmph.
<thinking>How will people know I’m better than them?
Remember, <PlayerName>, if everybody can afford your services,
<pumped>You aren’t charging enough.
<glee>You’ll be happy to hear that I’ve reinforced the pockets of my suit.
<yes><Dinks> can be quite heavy, you know.
<proud>No escapees on my watch!
You know, you are almost tolariable sometimes, <PlayerName>.
<yes>Especially when you are making a deposit into your account.
Sometimes I can be a bit harsh on you, <PlayerName>.
<thinking>You see, I’ve grown up knowing I’m better than everyone else.
<no>I’ve got to remember it doesn’t mean everyone else is rubbish.
What is that grotty old <Journal> you carry around all the time, anyway?
<haha>If I were you I would spend a few <Dinks> to get a new one!
<no>That looks like it's decades old!
You know, <PlayerName>.
<yes>I’ve got to say, you are always very helpful when it comes to fulfilling my requests.
Luckily, I always reward you accordingly, so a thanks isn’t really required here, is it?
If I had to guess, you might be the second wealthiest person on <IslandName>, <PlayerName>.
<proud>Hmph, of course I’m including my future inheritance that I am owed...
<shy><IslandName> isn’t that bad after you spend a while here, I guess.
<no>Oh, please, don’t get me wrong, <PlayerName>.
<proud>As soon as I get the chance I’m going to return to my lovely abode back in <SouthCity>.
<yes>I have an indoor swimming pool there you know.
<proud>It’s full of <Dinks>!
<proud>Hmph, <SouthCity> is so much better than <IslandName>.
<yes>There are so many more people willing to put money into banks and the like.
Hmph, I must admit, <IslandName> is somewhat of an up and coming place to be.
<thinking>Maybe I should invest in some property here...
Hmph. <IslandName> sure has changed a lot since you got here, <PlayerName>.
<shy>Hmph, it’s definitely no <SouthCity>, but I guess it’s not all bad here.
<thinking>I remember when I constantly wanted to get off <IslandName>.
<yes>But it is actually very tolerable here.
<no>These days, I only occasionally want to escape this wretched place.
Hmmph.
Flying this <Kite> reminds me a lot of my childhood.
<thinking>Maybe <Dinks> can’t buy happiness…
<no>No.
<no>That's a preposterous thought.
Hmmph.
Happy sky day, I guess.
<thinking>Oh, it’s <SkyFest> is it?
Whatever.
Hmmph.
<no>Same old <SkyFest> sky.
Just like last year, and the year before.
<yes>Once you’ve seen one <Aurora>, you’ve seen them all.
<shy>Although, I guess I did have some fun during this year’s <SkyFest> festivities…
<shocked>You mean I’m expected to make my own <Kite>!?
<no>What kind of event is this?
<pumped>I’ll tell you, <PlayerName>.
<angry>Poorly planned.
Hmmph.
So that <buyItemName> has caught your eye?
<yes>It allows you to withdraw your funds from your account.
<yes>Even when the bank is closed.
However, you will still have to visit the branch to deposit.
It can be yours for the low price of <buyItemPrice>?
I'll take it!
No thanks
Hmmph.
I hope you enjoy it.
<no>Very well then.
Hmph.
Morning.
Hmph.
What did I say?
Hmph.
Alright then.
Rotten day.
If you say so.
What are you so happy about?
This conversation will be over soon.
Hmph.
Whatever you say.
Hmph.
Whatever you say.
It’s ridiculous what they are charging.
I reckon it seems pretty fair.
Out with it. Time is <Dinks>.
You were talking to me!
I wouldn’t pay for weather like this.
Luckily it’s free.
<proud>Hmph, of course I’m including my future inheritance that I am owed...
Welcome back, <PlayerName>.
Are you here to talk business?
Want to buy anything?
Got any deals?
Nevermind.
<yes>Alright then. Just remember I only buy in bulk.
I won't take anything less than 50 of an item.
But I will pay double, just for you, <PlayerName>.
Have a great day.
I never wanted to come to this wretched place you know, <PlayerName>.
<no>My mother always said I had no ambition, no drive.
Well, when she died I was expecting to have all her <Dinks> you see?
Unfortunately she demanded that I get out of <SouthCity>.
<no>Can you believe she demanded that I go start a business if I wanted to inherit her money!
<no>Even in death, that woman is so selfish.
My family were some of the first to make it to <SouthCity> back when the world was going south.
We got in very early. I guess you could say we had first class tickets!
I’ve been told that things were very good before more and more riff-raff started turning up.
<no>Wanting to be fed, wanting a place to sleep and generally just wanting more than they could afford.
Luckily, my family kept our inheritance and passed it down generation to generation.
Hmph, nice to know that the rich stay rich, eh, <PlayerName>?
As soon as my obligations are met here on <IslandName> I will be leaving post haste.
<no>The people here are… too nice.
Everyone seems to get along.
Hmph. Give me <SouthCity> any day.
At least there, people know how I should be treated.
